Directions.1: Line a baking sheet with waxed paper.

Directions.2: Beat together the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth.

Directions.3: Spoon the mixture into a piping bag fitted with a large round tip.

Directions.4: With a sharp paring knife, cut a cone shape out of the top of each strawberry to leave a small hollow.

Directions.5: Pipe about 1 tablespoon of the cream cheese filling into each strawberry, making sure that the filling overflows a bit out of the top of the strawberry.

Directions.6: Place the graham cracker crumbs into a shallow bowl. Dip the filled side of the strawberry into the graham cracker crumbs, coating the exposed filling with crumbs.

Directions.7: Melt the chocolate and canola oil in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring after each interval, until warm and smooth, 1 to 3 minutes (depending on your microwave).

Directions.8: Dip the unfilled ends of the strawberries into the melted chocolate and place on the prepared baking sheet; refrigerate until set.
